</image>   <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GREENPOLITICS;fea9734f.1503">   <title>New RSA research funding schemes announced </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GREENPOLITICS;fea9734f.1503</link>   <description> ***Apologies for cross-posting***<br>Regional Studies Association<br>announced new research funding schemes<br><br>Dear List members,<br><br>We are pleased to announce that as part of the Regional Studies Association&lt;http://www.regionalstudies.org/&gt;\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds 50th anniversary new funding schemes and increased funding for Research Networks have been agreed. By offering these, the Association is seeking to raise the profile of regional research and its contribution if appropriate, to policy and practice. Research awards will be judged on the basis of the excellence of the research proposal and the ability of the applicant to communicate the results of the research broadly. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-09T14:29:22+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Daniela Carl</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GREENPOLITICS;fea9734f.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GREENPOLITICS;cfd8d85b.1502">   <title>Final Call for Abstracts for a fully funded workshop: Novel Approaches to Climate Governance and the role of Entrepreneurship </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GREENPOLITICS;cfd8d85b.1502</link>   <description> [cid:image003.jpg@01D050E1.AC225820]<br>Entrepreneurship and climate governance<br>Predictions of climate change paint an alarming picture and addressing the ensuing risks will require the introduction of radically novel public and private policies that help cut emissions and increase preparedness and resilience vis-\ufffd\ufffd-vis what now seem to be unavoidable effects of climate change.<br><br>This workshop will bring together 20-25 scholars under the flag of the COST Action INOGOV<http://www.inogov.eu/> (Innovations in Climate Governance) to discuss the role of entrepreneurship in bringing about radical transitions in climate governance. Entrepreneurial initiatives are often regarded as absolutely crucial for the kind of policy invention and innovation processes that [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-25T10:01:51+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Andy Jordan (ENV)</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GREENPOLITICS;cfd8d85b.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GREENPOLITICS;45042903.1502">   <title>Postdoctoral position at University College Cork </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GREENPOLITICS;45042903.1502</link>   <description> Dear all,<br><br>Please see below an 18 month postdoctoral position at University College<br>Cork, Ireland, on a project the aim of which is to design a<br>socially-inclusive financial instrument to attract investment capital to<br>resource efficient assets.<br><br>Best wishes,<br><br>Diarmuid<br><br>--<br>*Dr. Diarmuid Torney*<br><br>Lecturer in International Relations<br>School of Law and Government<br>Dublin City University<br>Glasnevin<br>Dublin 9<br>Ireland<br><br>Tel. +353 1 700 6468<br>Email: diarmuid.torney@dcu.ie<br>Skype. diarmuidtorney<br>Twitter: @diarmuidtorney [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-15T11:59:22+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Diarmuid Torney</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GREENPOLITICS;45042903.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GREENPOLITICS;e7417acd.1502">   <title>Call for papers on panel: \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdCan the Green Economy save the climate?\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Paris 7-10 July 2015</title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GREENPOLITICS;e7417acd.1502</link>   <description> ** Apologies for cross-posting**<br><br>*Our Common Future Under Climate Change<br>&lt;http://www.commonfuture-paris2015.org/How-to-Contribute/Contributions.htm&gt;*<br><br>*Paris, 7-10 July 2015*<br><br>*Deadline for abstracts: 2 March 2015*<br><br>*Parallel Session: Green Transition and Growth*<br><br>*Proposed Panel: \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdCan the Green Economy save the climate?\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd*<br><br>The United Nations Conference on Sustainable Development in June 2012<br>(Rio+20) has given way to a heated debate about the \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdgreen economy\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd, a<br>concept promoted by United Nations Organizations (e.g. UNEP, 2012<br>&lt;#14b7ec3658dab9b8__ENREF_4&gt;) with the aim to sketch a desirable and<br>practicable way out of the multiple environmental and social crises the<br>world faces today. The green economy is a concept that has its [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-13T10:06:21+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Hayley Stevenson</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GREENPOLITICS;e7417acd.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GREENPOLITICS;67d97678.1502">   <title>Greening of Capitalism </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GREENPOLITICS;67d97678.1502</link>   <description> Dear SDRN Subscribers,<br><br>We hope the following titles will be of interest to you.<br><br>[Greening of Capitalism]&lt;http://www.combinedacademic.co.uk/greening-of-capitalism&gt;Greening of Capitalism&lt;http://www.combinedacademic.co.uk/greening-of-capitalism&gt;<br><br>How Asia Is Driving the Next Great Transformation<br>John Mathews<br>&quot;This book dwarfs all others I have read. It has an impressive finish: a blend of neo-Schumpeterian, neo-Gerschenkronian, and neo-Olsonian perspectives which provide a holistic and potent approach for addressing the next great transformation.&quot;-Rajah Rasiah, University of Malaya<br>"John Mathews' indispensable contribution sets the record straight about China's startling development of green energy, while making the case for the possibility-and the necessity-of a greening capitalism. The outcome of the race between [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-11T13:34:55+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Rachel Shand</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GREENPOLITICS;67d97678.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GREENPOLITICS;27bc8632.1502">   <title>2nd CfP: Young Scholars Workshop - Turkey and Global Climate Change Politics / 16-17 April 2015 / Istanbul </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GREENPOLITICS;27bc8632.1502</link>   <description> Apologies for cross-posting   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-11T12:14:31+02:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Ethemcan Turhan</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GREENPOLITICS;27bc8632.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GREENPOLITICS;52e172e.1502">   <title>Call for paper proposals - Learning from the past: the environmental NGOs at a crossroads. Oxford, 18-19 June 2015 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GREENPOLITICS;52e172e.1502</link>   <description> ** Apologies for cross-posting**<br><br>Learning from the past: the environmental NGOs at a crossroads<br>Oxford, 18-19 June 2015<br><br>The workshop aims to bring together historians and social scientists who share a common interest in the study of the changes affecting environmental NGOs in Europe. While favouring comparison both over time and between organisations, we welcome a diversity of approaches. The workshop will thus address the most recent trends affecting environmental NGOs as well as the strategies characterising earlier periods of expansion. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-09T18:44:11+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Nathalie Berny</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GREENPOLITICS;52e172e.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GREENPOLITICS;a7ef076e.1502">   <title>RSA Annual Conference 2015 - Abstract Submission Deadline Extended </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GREENPOLITICS;a7ef076e.1502</link>   <description> Regional Studies Association Annual Conference 2015<br>Global Growth Agendas: Regions, Institutions and Sustainability<br>24th - 27th May, 2015, Universit\ufffd\ufffd Cattolica del Sacro Cuore, Piacenza, Italy<br><br>Dear list members,<br><br>In light of ongoing demand, the deadline for abstract submission and the early bird registration fee for the RSA Annual Conference in Piacenza have been extended until Sunday 15th February 2015. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-09T12:24:15+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Daniela Carl</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GREENPOLITICS;a7ef076e.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GREENPOLITICS;f7ccfd8f.1502">   <title>Fwd: Final Chance: Call for Panels and Papers </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GREENPOLITICS;f7ccfd8f.1502</link>   <description> Dear members of the Environmental Politics Standing Group<br><br>Just a reminder that the deadline is fast approaching for submitting<br>panel and paper proposals for the General Conference in Montreal.<br><br>Environmental Politics Section call:<br>/This section aims to run eight panels focusing on current issues in and<br>approaches to environmental politics and policy. We expect to attract a<br>diverse range of panels from scholars working throughout the academic<br>political science community. Environmental themes are relevant to an<br>increasing number of political research clusters, including (but not<br>limited to) those specialising in public policy, parties and elections,<br>international relations, social movements, and [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-05T13:44:53+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Sherilyn MacGregor</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GREENPOLITICS;f7ccfd8f.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GREENPOLITICS;47fea2b8.1502">   <title>Call for papers, ECPR Montreal: Conceptual Foundations of Earth System Governance </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GREENPOLITICS;47fea2b8.1502</link>   <description> ** Apologies for cross-posting**<br><br>*ECPR General Conference*<br><br>*Universit\ufffd\ufffd de Montr\ufffd\ufffdal 26 - 29 August 2015*<br><br>http://www.ecpr.eu/Events/EventDetails.aspx?EventID=94<br><br>*Section: *Environmental Politics<br><br>*Panel title: *Conceptual Foundations of Earth System Governance<br><br>*Panel chairs: *James Meadowcroft (Carleton) and Hayley Stevenson<br>(Sheffield)<br><br>*Description*: This panel will bring together papers exploring the key<br>ideas that are framing debates around environmental governance during a<br>period of global environmental change and earth system transformation. We<br>anticipate papers focused on particular concepts (such as \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdplanetary<br>boundaries\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd, \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdenvironmental limits\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd, \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdthe Anthropocene\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd, \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdresilience\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd, \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdthe<br>green economy\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd, etc.), as well as theoretical papers exploring the<br>relationship between conceptual innovation and institutional innovation. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-03T16:08:06+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Hayley Stevenson</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GREENPOLITICS;47fea2b8.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GREENPOLITICS;253bee11.1502">   <title>CfP - Special Issue of "Climate Policy" - The 2020 Strategy Experience: Lessons for Regional Cooperation, EU Governance and Investment </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GREENPOLITICS;253bee11.1502</link>   <description> *CALL FOR PAPERS: **&quot;The 2020 Strategy Experience: Lessons for Regional<br>Cooperation, EU Governance and Investment&quot; - contribution to a Special<br>Issue of the Climate Policy journal*<br><br>With the agreement on the 2030 energy and climate targets there is a clear<br>need to speed up the process of decarbonization of the European economy.<br>But there are still numerous issues that need to be clarified. How can the<br>EU member states achieve their renewable energy and climate targets in<br>efficient ways? What governance mechanisms can improve regional cooperation<br>and coordination? How can increased investment levels be triggered? Can<br>the experience of the [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-03T13:48:41+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Kacper Szulecki</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GREENPOLITICS;253bee11.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GREENPOLITICS;d614b4a5.1501">   <title>New book: Governance for Urban Sustainability and Resilience </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GREENPOLITICS;d614b4a5.1501</link>   <description> Dear colleagues,<br><br>I am happy to announce that Edward Elgar Publishers recently published my book &quot;Governance for Urban Sustainability and Resilience: Responding to Climate Change and the Relevance of the Built Environment&quot;. It takes as point of departure that cities, and the built environment more broadly, are key in the global response to climate change. It seeks understand what governance tools are best suited for achieving cities that are less harmful to the natural environment, are less dependent on finite resources, and can better withstand human-made hazards and climate risks. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-27T22:41:32+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Jeroen van der Heijden</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GREENPOLITICS;d614b4a5.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GREENPOLITICS;44e42afd.1501">   <title>CFP: The Good Society - The Civic Dimension of Environmental Policy </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GREENPOLITICS;44e42afd.1501</link>   <description> Please distribute widely.<br><br>Manuscripts will be due August 1st, 2015. They should be submitted here<br>(http://www.editorialmanager.com/gs/) and formatted for blind review.<br>Please see our website &lt;http://goodsocietyjournal.org/&gt; for more details.<br><br>Possible topics include:<br>Citizen-scientists and civic science<br>Environmental issues in science communication<br>Civic engagement in regulatory rulemaking beyond comment periods<br>The prospects and pitfalls of environmental mass movements<br>Principle-agent problems (and solutions) in environmental diplomacy<br>Civil society\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds role in watershed management<br>Common-pool resource management strategies<br>Empirical evidence from deliberative forums, deliberative polling, and<br>citizens juries on environmental policy preferences<br>The political economy of cap and trade, carbon taxes, and carbon offsets<br> [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-27T10:48:22-06:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Corey Katz</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GREENPOLITICS;44e42afd.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GREENPOLITICS;933a9179.1501">   <title>When Green Growth is Not Enough: Climate Change, Ecological Modernization, and Sufficiency </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GREENPOLITICS;933a9179.1501</link>   <description> [9780773544086]When Green Growth Is Not Enough<br>Climate Change, Ecological Modernization, and Sufficiency<br>Anders Hayden<br>&quot;When Green Growth Is Not Enough will inform a wide North American audience about European climate change and policy - we simply do not hear about this in conventional media and no similar debate takes place in Canada and the United States. We need this public discussion of what might be done and how we might do it.&quot;-Robert Paehlke, Environmental and Resource Studies, Trent University<br>Is the pursuit of endless economic growth compatible with the deep reductions in greenhouse gas emissions required to avoid the worst [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-26T13:53:12+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Charles Woodhead</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GREENPOLITICS;933a9179.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GREENPOLITICS;16072426.1501">   <title>CfP: Beyond Special Circumstances: Turkey and Global Climate Change Politics / 16-17 April 2015 / Istanbul </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GREENPOLITICS;16072426.1501</link>   <description> *Beyond Special Circumstances: Turkey and Global Climate Change Politics*<br><br>*Young Scholars Workshop*<br><br>*16-17 April 2015*<br><br>*Co-organized by *<br><br>Istanbul Policy Center (IPC), Sabanc\ufffd\ufffd University<br><br>&amp;<br><br>Marmara University Research Center for International Relations (MURCIR)<br><br>&amp;<br><br>Agence Fran\ufffd\ufffdaise de D\ufffd\ufffdveloppement (AFD)<br><br>*Call for Papers*<br><br>Being an Annex-I party to the United Nations Framework Convention on<br>Climate Change (UNFCCC) and a party to Kyoto Protocol (KP) without any<br>commitment in its first period, Turkey has a peculiar position in the<br>global climate change negotiations. Having ratified both the framework<br>convention and the KP with 12 years of delay, Turkey had the highest rate<br> [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-24T10:47:24+02:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Ethemcan Turhan</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GREENPOLITICS;16072426.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GREENPOLITICS;4457e47a.1501">   <title>ENVIRONMENTAL POLITICS Volume 24 Number 1 February 2015 is now online </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GREENPOLITICS;4457e47a.1501</link>   <description> Now online at:<br>http://www.tandfonline.com/toc/fenp20/current#.VMFqUlqlkvo<br><br>ENVIRONMENTAL POLITICS Volume 24 Number 1 February 2015<br><br>CONTENTS<br><br>Articles<br><br>Reason and rhetoric in climate communication<br>John S. Dryzek and Alex Y. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-15T10:50:12+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Rauno Sairinen</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GREENPOLITICS;6444c9b3.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GREENPOLITICS;be4b247a.1412">   <title>Novel Approaches to Climate Governance and the role of Entrepreneurship: Funded workshop - abstract call </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GREENPOLITICS;be4b247a.1412</link>   <description> Novel Approaches to Climate Governance and the role of Entrepreneurship<br>18-19 May 2015, Amsterdam<br>Entrepreneurship and climate governance<br>Predictions of climate change paint an alarming picture and addressing the ensuing risks will require the introduction of radically different public and private policies that cut emissions, promote adaptation and encourage resilience. This fully funded workshop will bring together 20-25 scholars under the flag of the COST Action INOGOV<http://www.inogov.eu/> (Innovations in Climate Governance) to discuss the role of entrepreneurship in bringing about radical transitions in climate governance. Entrepreneurial initiatives are often regarded as absolutely crucial for the kind of policy invention and [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-22T16:01:30+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Andy Jordan (ENV)</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GREENPOLITICS;be4b247a.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GREENPOLITICS;e74ca266.1412">   <title>Policy innovation in a changing climate: special issue of GEC </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GREENPOLITICS;e74ca266.1412</link>   <description> States have been widely criticized for failing to advance the international climate regime. But many observers now believe that a "new" climate governance is emerging through transnational and/or local forms of action that will eventually plug the resulting governance gaps. Yet states, which remain oddly absent from most discussions of the 'new' governance, will remain key players as governance becomes more polycentric. This special section explores the ability of states to rise to these interconnected challenges through the analytical prism of policy innovation. It reveals that policy innovation is much more multi-dimensional than is often thought; it encompasses three vital [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-19T09:41:00+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Andy Jordan (ENV)</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GREENPOLITICS;e74ca266.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GREENPOLITICS;12d39ed5.1412">   <title>Call for paper proposals - Learning from the past: the environmental NGOs at a crossroads. Oxford, 18-19 June 2015 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GREENPOLITICS;12d39ed5.1412</link>   <description> Learning from the past: the environmental NGOs at a crossroads<br>Oxford, 18-19 June 2015<br><br>The workshop aims to bring together historians and social scientists who share a common interest in the study of the changes affecting environmental NGOs in Europe. Recent political and economic developments at the global level have created dilemmas for the future, including over the optimal course of action for organisations that have limited resources in face of what could be a &quot;green backlash&quot; similar to that of the 1980s (Rowell 1996). [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-18T15:55:37+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Nathalie Berny</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GREENPOLITICS;12d39ed5.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GREENPOLITICS;3fc4c42a.1412">   <title>PhD applications now open for environment pathway on the Southampton ESRC DTC </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GREENPOLITICS;3fc4c42a.1412</link>   <description> Dear colleagues (sorry for cross-posting),<br><br>Applications are now open for places on the ESRC Doctoral Training Centre&lt;http://www.southampton.ac.uk/esrcdtc/index.page?&gt; at the University of Southampton. Applications are welcome for the Energy, Environment and Resilience Pathway which provides +4 PhD fellowships. The application deadline is 13 February 2015. Candidates on this pathway will need to identify supervisors from at least one additional Faculty outside of the Faculty of Social and Human Sciences. For more information please see the pathway website&lt;http://www.southampton.ac.uk/esrcdtc/pathways/individualpathways/energy_environment_resilience_pathway.page?&gt; or contact the pathway coordinators Milena Buchs m.buechs@soton.ac.uk&lt;mailto:m.buechs@soton.ac.uk&gt; or Ellie Biggs e.m.biggs@soton.ac.uk&lt;mailto:e.m.biggs@soton.ac.uk&gt; .<br>If you could pass it on to potential applicants we would [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-11T11:58:08+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Buchs M.</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GREENPOLITICS;3fc4c42a.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GREENPOLITICS;ee3f7c35.1412">   <title>PhD Studentship Political Science Ecosystem Approach Forestry </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GREENPOLITICS;ee3f7c35.1412</link>   <description> PhD studentship in political science: The Ecosystem Approach and the<br>sustainable management of forests in Aquitaine: A political sociology of<br>science-politics interactions<br><br>The Unit 'Environment, Actors and Territorial Dynamics' of the French<br>National Research Institute on Science, Technology, Environment and<br>Agriculture at Bordeaux (Irstea:<br>http://www.irstea.fr/linstitut/nos-centres/bordeaux) invites<br>applications for a PhD studentship in political science on the Ecosystem<br>Approach, ecosystem science-politics interactions, and the sustainable<br>management of forests in Aquitaine. The studentship will commence in<br>October 2015 for 3 years. <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GREENPOLITICS;1276b904.1412</link>   <description> Building upon the successfully organized WPSA 2015, Las Vegas Panel 02.02 \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdExploring a Habitability Approach in Environmental Political Theory\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd we would like to propose one or more panels for the APSA 2015, San Francisco meeting that will further examine antipathies and possibly, points of rapport, between the notions of habitation (construed as the way a community makes use of its environment to support its form of life), and habitability (the dynamic match or mis-match between its environment and the form of life it seeks to lead). We invite papers that articulate those relationships in a specifically political way, hence that [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-02T19:49:39+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Andy Scerri</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GREENPOLITICS;1276b904.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GREENPOLITICS;d4361436.1412">   <title>Fwd: [Degrowth] Call for Hosting the 5th International Conference on Degrowth (To be held in 2016) </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GREENPOLITICS;d4361436.1412</link>   <description> FYI<br><br>---------- Forwarded message ----------<br>From: &lt;network@degrowth.net&gt;<br>Date: Mon, Dec 1, 2014 at 6:18 PM<br>Subject: [Degrowth] Call for Hosting the 5th International Conference on<br>Degrowth (To be held in 2016)<br>To:<br><br>Please, Disseminate widely...<br><br>*Open Call for Hosting the Fifth International Conference on Degrowth for<br>Ecological Sustainability and Social Equity*<br><br>The international conferences on degrowth<br>&lt;http://www.degrowth.org/conferences&gt; are central landmarks and moments of<br>convergence of the international degrowth<br>&lt;http://www.degrowth.org/definition-2&gt; intellectual and social movement.<br>They offer an unique opportunity for bringing together scholars with other<br>members of civil society and demonstrating a different way of organizing<br>conferences. A central feature of [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-01T18:46:13+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Viviana Asara</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GREENPOLITICS;d4361436.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GREENPOLITICS;2708e46d.1412">   <title>Two ERC-funded PhD Studentships in Politics/Social Science </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GREENPOLITICS;2708e46d.1412</link>   <description> Dear ECPR Environmental Politics Standing Group members<br><br>I am currently advertising two fully-funded PhD positions on a project<br>of mine.
